channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WI
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WI

item.title: Report E-2025040170
item.description:
Report E-2025040170

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-07
  • City: JANESVILLE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 7, 2205, one (1) 5-gallon jug of UN1197 was damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) To remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents, cleaning agents, and hand tools to remediate the trailer. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged jug was placed in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025040757
item.description:
Report X-2025040757

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-04
  • City: OAK CREEK
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER WAS CALLED TO THE SORT AISLE FOR A LEAKING PACKAGE. RESPONDER HAD TO ASK WHY THE SUPERVISOR MOVED THE LEAKER OFF THE BELT AND ONTO THE GRATING. RESPONDER PLACED THE PACKAGE IN A LINED SPILL TRAY AND TOOK IT TO THE SERVICE CANTER FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.

item.title: Report E-2025040084
item.description:
Report E-2025040084

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-02
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L RACING, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 2, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1170 was punctured and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the dock. All impacted materials were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025040034
item.description:
Report E-2025040034

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-28
  • City: MILWAUKEE
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On March 28, 2025, one (1) 50-pound bag of UN3378 was ripped and released approximately one (1) quart of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from HazChem Environmental (HCE) to remediate the site. The crew utilized a HEPA vacuum unit to remediate the dock floor. All impacted materials and the loose product were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025040127
item.description:
Report E-2025040127

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-06T01:06:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-03-14
  • City: RICHLAND CENTER
  • State: WI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At the end of the offload our driver hooked up an airline that runs from the compressor on the tractor to an air inlet valve that comes off of the discharge valve used for sampling and blowing the lines clean at the end of offloading. He turned on the air compressor and opened the external valve partially and began walking the line but it wasn't get light like it should. he looked back and saw that the end of the airline connected to the compressor on his truck came off the connection and product was backflowing from his product hose into the discharge valve and ultimately through the airline and on to the ground. Estimating 16 ounces hit the ground.
